content: watch the video https //youtu be/qgzuy1s2ezi as the air turns crisp and the leaves begin to fall there s nothing quite like bringing the warmth of autumn into your home with a handmade touch these adorable knitted pumpkins are the perfect cosy project for those quiet evenings by the fire or a rainy afternoon with a cup of tea in hand whether you re a beginner or an experienced knitter this pattern offers a versatile and fun way to create your own seasonal décor you can choose to knit your pumpkin flat or in the round whatever feels best to you with the flexibility to use any weight yarn from light and delicate to thick and chunky you can truly make each pumpkin your own you can even hold two yarns together to create a rich marled effect or a thicker squishy fabric the possibilities are endless so feel free to get creative with colours textures and sizes let s get started on filling your home with handmade charm this fall **materials** yarn of your choice for one pumpkin you will need approx 8 - 14 m / 9 15 yds of yarn **needles and notions ** if knitting in the round use circular needles long enough for magic loop or double pointed needles you want a tight fabric so use a needle size that quite small for your yarn as a guide sock weight yarn 2 0 mm us 1 needles sock weight yarn held double 3 25 mm us 3 needles worsted weight yarn 3 25 3 5 mm us 3-4 chunky weight yarn 5 0 mm us 8 **gauge** there is no set gauge but i have put some needle recommendations for different types of yarn however it will depend on whether you are a loose or tight knitter you want your knitting to come out quite dense as you will be stuffing them and stretching the knitting a bit **size** this will depend on your yarn gauge stuffing and how much you cinch your pumpkin as a guide sock weight 2 5 cm / 1 inch across worsted weight 4 5 cm / 1¾ inches across chunky weight 6 5 cm / 2½ inches across
